title: Lake Clark National Park & Preserve: Education
body: A Diversity of Wilderness Trek through mountain ranges, coastal areas, tundra, lakes or foot hills as an exploring student of Lake Clark and check out our curriculum-based lesson plans. Teachers and students can explore the park's resources through lesson plans, downloadable materials or other features below.                 How Many Salmon Are Enough? This lesson takes real life experiences and scientific data to let students gain an understanding of how wildlife and humans are connected. Read More        How Clear Is the Water? This fun, hands-on lab lets students be scientists as they test turbidity (water clarity) and make predictions based on their findings. Read More        Carrying Capacity and Bears in Alaska Students will be looking at the bears of Lake Clark National Park and in the Denali area to see why some reproduce more often and live easier lives. Read More        Teaching with Historic Places The Teaching With Historic Places program offers a variety of activities that help teachers bring historic places, like Lake Clark into the classroom. Read More        Multimedia Check out interactive panoramic photographs taken throughout the park and watch our videocast of spectacular scenery, wildlife, and people. Read More
